Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Kn2-7 (BmKn2-7, BmKn2 analog, synthetic AMPs20a, XXA, UCLL1c, BBL)
Sequence Information.Source: amino acid substitution, animal-derived, natural derivative

Literature Information.Literature: Sequence analysis: APD analysis reveals that this sequence is similar (76.92%) toparent peptide BmKn2I=R: 23%, L=F=K: 15%.Activity: active against Gram- E. coli AB94012 or ATCC 25922 (MIC 6.25-25 ug/ml), P. aeruginosa AB93066 or A092994 like 5 strains (MIC 25-100 ug/ml), Gram+ S. aureus AB94004 or ATCC 25923 or MRSA (MIC 3.13 ug/ml),  S. epidermidis (MIC 2.5-5.0 ug/ml),  E. faecalis (MIC 5-10 ug/ml), E. faecium (MIC 5 ug/ml), B. subtilis AB91021 (MIC 6.25 ug/ml), B. thuringiensis AB92037 (MIC 6.25 ug/ml), and M. luteus AB93113 (MIC 6.25 ug/ml).Structure: random coil in water and become helical in 30% or 70% TFE.In vitro toxicity: human RBC: HC50 >100 ug/ml, less hemo.lytic.Animal model:mouse:  skin infected with S. aureus: showed wound healing effect (Cao et al., 2012).
Literature Information.Author: Cao L, Dai C, Li Z, Fan Z, Song Y, Wu Y, Cao Z, Li W.2012
Literature Information.Title: Antibacterial activity and mechanism of a scorpion venom peptide derivative in vitro and in vivo.
